attributes.action: Change the recycling bag to a wheelie bin.
attributes.background: I would like to change the recycling bags to a wheelie bin instead.  I previously lived in Middlesbrough where the council issues wheelie bins for the recycling and much more can fit inside and therefore more can be recycled each fortnight.
attributes.additional_details: A large amount of my neighbours have too much recycling so are unable to close their recycling bag due to the amount enclosed. The same number and more add recycling alongside the bag in a separate box.  Both of these acts cause litter as the recycling is not properly contained. I only wish for the bag to be swapped for a wheelie bin.  If you deem it better to keep the glass in the separate container I do not object to that. Thinking about the environment is more important now than ever.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Encourage all secondary schools to adopt timetabled, live-streamed lessons.
attributes.background: Whilst the use of streaming apps/services has been widely adopted it has not been embraced by all schools. This puts many pupils at a disadvantage. We ask the Government to encourage schools to live-stream lessons for core subjects alongside others where possible and keep to a timetable.
attributes.additional_details:
Live-streamed lessons:
• Help minimise online distractions for pupils
• Maintain a consistent standard of teaching
• Assist in-school and remote learning simultaneously
• Encourage engagement and feedback
• Can be recorded and made accessible on demand
• Are not restricted to a specific class size
• Promote safer social interaction in a closed online environment
• Provide a routine and structure to the day
• Help parents working from home
• Facilitate a smooth transition when schools reopen

attributes.action: Reinstate the ban on bee killing pesticides
attributes.background: The government has allowed the use of bee killing pesticides that are banned in the EU a little over a week after separating.
attributes.additional_details:
Gaining power back from the EU was never supposed to be about allowing us to destroy our environment and delicate ecosystems

https://www.thelondoneconomic.com/news/uk-farmers-given-go-ahead-to-use-bee-killing-pesticide-banned-by-eu/09/01/

attributes.action: Ban the use of Neonicotinoid Pesticides in order to protect bees
attributes.background:
Bees are major pollinators and vital to our eco system.
We have lost a third of our bee population and up to 50% of other insects in recent years.
The Government banned the use of Neonicotinoids in 2018 because of this, but now appears to have back-tracked on this wise policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Eustice plans to allow the use of this chemical in sugar beet production, treating the seeds to prevent the spread of a virus in the crop. However, this will cause a significant risk to bees and other pollinators. 

Neonicotinoid pesticides should therefore be banned permanently, and not used even in the "limited and controlled" way proposed by the Environment Secretary.

attributes.action: A plastic free day in all UK schools.
attributes.background: What I want the Government or Parliament to do is to legislate a plastic-free day all across UK schools and education centres.
attributes.additional_details:
My reasons are that
 A. Plastics are not good for life under the sea 
B. Plastics are dangerous and can choke any animal that mistakes it for food
C. Little animals can get stuck in them and 
D. One plastic-free day a month/year can make a huge difference to improving our environment.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about plastics, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. It sounds like you want to make it illegal for schools to use any products containing plastic for one day a year, but it's not clear how this would work in practice.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Establish a national waste plastic collection/recycling programme for England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553651

Introduce a levy on single-use disposable plastic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554035

Heavy tax and public awareness on all 'Not Yet Recycled' plastics: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315755

Reduced VAT on plastic-free products: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552824

Impose a levy on all plastic production in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555701

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to fund a public awareness programme for schools on plastics, if that's something you would like to happen.

attributes.action: Keep all public swimming pools open during lockdown
attributes.background: The Government understands the importance of fitness and health in the population. Swimming is an exercise that many can enjoy, supporting wellness and wellbeing. Swimming pools have shown to be Covid safe environments. Please consider people's wellbeing in mind, and keep swimming accessible.
attributes.additional_details: The importance of swimming is evident to the young and old, keeping them away from medical care, and supporting both their fitness levels and most importantly their mental wellbeing. I have 'hidden' illnesses, but these are kept at bay by swimming daily. Swimming is safe, no incidents of Covid as a result of pools being open, it would help thousands of people across the country to keep going during lockdown and not add to the numbers going to hospital.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Keep the gyms open during this 2nd lockdown
attributes.background: We truly believe our sector is essential to the battle with Covid and keeping fit and healthy, Loss of gyms will damage activity levels resulting in a detrimental impact on mental health of the nation. Stats show gyms are not an unsafe environment, we have implemented Covid safe guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: To keep people mental health and well being in a state where people don’t go insane during these hard time

attributes.action: Ban All Single-Use Plastic Bags in the UK
attributes.background: It’s estimated that by the year 2050 there will be more plastic in the oceans than fish. Most single use plastic bags are non-recyclable and will end up in our environment as well as our oceans, polluting and ruining the ocean’s ecosystems. We want the Government to ban all single use plastic bags.
attributes.additional_details:
By banning the single use plastic bag, the UK can send a powerful message that it can be a global environmental leader and inspire other countries to follow our lead. Retailers should offer recycled paper bags for 10p fee or offer reusable bags made out of sustainable materials such as hemp, linen, bamboo, etc. 

Please sign the petition and once you are done share it with everyone you know who cares about the environment and their future on this planet.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Ban plastic bags for online supermarket deliveries: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549991

attributes.action: SEND training should be compulsory in teaching degrees to learn about ASD/ADHD
attributes.background: Currently in a teacher degree to learn about SEND is optional. We want government to make this an integral part of the degree and compulsory.
attributes.additional_details: in the UK one in 100 people are autistic, and 5% are ADHD. It is likely that a teacher will have one in their classroom. However it is compulsory to learn about this in teaching and a classroom can end up being a hostile environment. Children with these conditions who fail in school end up costing the state in terms of social care and a higher increase in criminality etc. Also If teachers were trained then they could identify the conditions earlier allowing for earlier support and success

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for the content of teacher training degrees, this is a matter for individual providers of teacher training.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to require mandatory training on ASD/ADHD for teachers, if that is something you would like to happen.

attributes.action: Specific Government Covid-19 secure guidance is required for Tanning Salons
attributes.background: The Government should be required to update its Covid-19 secure guidance, so that there is separate guidance for Tanning Salons, which recognises that this is not a close contact service, and that the guidance on close contact services does not refer to Tanning Salons.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, Tanning Salons are incorrectly classed as a close-contact service with respect to Covid-19 restrictions. Tanning Salons are entirely contact free, and have an almost uniquely maintained environment giving rise to enhanced ventilation of the entire premises.

attributes.action: Schools should shut down due to covid-19
attributes.background: Shut schools down due to covid-19 with the rule of six restriction in place, schools have very limited social distancing and is unsafe for students to be in an environment where it is not safe, they could have high risk family members
attributes.additional_details: Because of the high risk families it is unsafe to be in an environment where there is barely any social distancing, as school has reopened corona virus infections have rised, please enforce this as i and many others belive it is unsafe

attributes.action: Make BSL mandatory in Primary School Education.
attributes.background: Over the past years, deaf schools have continued to close, meaning that deaf children are now being taught in mainstream environments. If hearing children were given the chance to learn BSL at school, deaf children would have much better access to not only their education, but also their peers.
attributes.additional_details: The more people learning BSL through their education, the more access deaf people would have to wider society. There are about 11 million people in the UK who are deaf or hard of hearing. 11 million peoples lives that could  have been made so much easier by introducing BSL classes to the more privileged people of society from a young age. There is a lot of work to be done to gain the equality of deaf people, and to heighten the awareness in Parliament is a great way to begin.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331031

attributes.action: Stop dangerous pollution from poultry farms along the Wye and its tributaries.
attributes.background: Intensive poultry units (IPUs) along the River Wye and its tributaries are turning it into a wildlife deathtrap and causing untold damage to one of Britain’s best loved rivers. Runoff from IPUs causes the spread of algal blooms that devastate the river’s ecosystem and turn the water a murky green.
attributes.additional_details: Take long-term strategic action to ensure that the UK poultry industry is environmentally sound, through effective delivery of the Environment Act, Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017, the Well-Being of Future Generations Act and the Water Framework Directive. Conduct urgent research, regulate and monitor IPUs and enforce LPA planning conditions. Regulate the poultry industry and hold it to account for breach of environmental responsibility. Publish public reports on progress.

rejection.details:
Your petition appears to relate to activities in Wales, and planning and the environment are devolved matters, so the responsibility of the Welsh Government, Welsh local authorities and Natural Resources Wales, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You can petition the Welsh Parliament here: https://petitions.senedd.wales/

attributes.action: Stop the rebranding of the RAF Voyager (PM/Royal Family plane)
attributes.background: Plans have been unveiled to re-brand the RAF Voyager, the plane that is used by the Prime Minster, other ministers and senior members of the Royal Family for official engagements. This is estimated to be £900,000 and funded by taxpayers - but is completely unnecessary.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should not carry out this rebrand. The money could be better spent elsewhere, including but not limited to: supporting vulnerable people through the COVID-19 pandemic and afterwards, the NHS (including social and mental illness care), education and the environment. In a time where the economy is fragile, this kind of spending is insensitive for those looking at redundancy and low income families, as well as genuinely shortsighted and ridiculous.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Teach history of global slave trade as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum
attributes.background: Currently there is no coverage of the history of the global slave trade in our national curriculum being taught in UK schools.  In light of current events it should be a requirement to teach a balanced account of the entire global trade and not just the British Empire's involvement in the trade.
attributes.additional_details: The subject of the British Colonial Slave Trade is an ongoing and very sensitive issue. Clearly there is no changing history but ignorance of all the historical facts are creating divides in our country today. Education is the key to breaking down racial barriers at a younger age. If impartial and informed discussions can be had in a controlled educational environment then there has to be hope for a more inclusive and harmonious future.

attributes.action: Extend post-study work visa for 2019/20 international Master’s students
attributes.background: Please bring forward by one year the policy of a 2-year entitlement to work, in respect of 2019/20 Master’s students. Taking a 1-year course, they have been deprived of the major part of the anticipated international and practical experience due to industrial action and the Covid-19 pandemic.
attributes.additional_details:
These students have lost out on developing debating skills and network building with 6 weeks of strikes and the digital environment in lockdown being disrupted and absent of the essential interaction and frank discussion which can only take place in the physical environment.

The significant effects have encompassed cancellation of dissertation work placements, field trips, student conferences, guest speaker talks and cross-departmental presentation – severely curtailing the experience gained.

attributes.action: Start using eco-friendly methods of transport to deliver food in city centres
attributes.background: introduce a law that stops takeaways and restaurants from using cars and mopeds as a means of delivering food within a radius to the town center. Pollution is damaging the country and if we start cutting down how much pollution is spread then we are saving the future generation.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to do it because not only is this saving the environment but it is a smart strategic move because if we can start of small then imagine the greater cause, it will boost revenue as there are a lot of start-up companies that can benefit from this move.

attributes.action: Ban the manufacture and sale of disposable vapes
attributes.background: Allowing the manufacture and sale of disposable vapes is undermining national targets to reduce the amount of chemicals and plastics entering the environment. Government must work urgently with manufacturers and retailers to ban the manufacture and sale of disposable vapes to protect the environment
attributes.additional_details:
Disposable vapes contain lithium batteries, metal wiring and plastic parts. 

Carelessly discarded vapes now litter the UK and pose a choking hazard to wildlife. The batteries pose a fire hazard and leach toxic chemicals into the environment. 

Research suggests that people in the UK are throwing away approximately two disposable vapes every second, resulting in 10 tonnes of lithium being sent to landfill every year.

Lithium is a precious metal that is used in electric cars and solar panels.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/628115

attributes.action: Ban Single-Use Electronic Cigarettes.
attributes.background: They are made of plastic and a hazardous lithium-ion battery These chemicals are extremely hazardous to the environment and wildlife. The batteries are also fully rechargeable. they are simply designed without a power connection to render them obsolete after 24 hours use.
attributes.additional_details: It is very contradictory against the green agenda that is going on at the moment. Citizens are being told to work more hours and take shorter showers when corporations are being allowed to profit from this kind of plastic and chemical waste destined for landfill and the ground. Look around on any street and you will see these devices on the ground. often with their batteries hanging out. These batteries have potential years of use in them. designing them to be disposed of so quickly is immoral.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612333

attributes.action: Students should not go into school during exceedingly hot weather.
attributes.background: Students should not have to go into school during exceedingly hot weather and instead be replaced via online learning.
attributes.additional_details: In recent years, weather temperatures have been climbing and climbing as a result of climate change - this has made it so students, such as myself, have found it hard to study and concentrate during class due to the weather temperature and little being done to cool the classrooms, with many schools avoiding solutions such as air conditioning due its price and impact on the environment.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about when to close schools because of severe weather are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to require schools to close if temperatures exceed a certain level, but it would need to be clear when you want schools to be required to close.

The Department for Education has published advice for teachers and other professionals looking after children during heatwaves, which you can find here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/heatwave-plan-for-england/looking-after-children-and-those-in-early-years-settings-during-heatwaves-for-teachers-and-professionals

attributes.action: To implement a major reform to the delivery the 11-16 curriculum in UK.
attributes.background: To prioritise the teaching of practical and creative learning rather than learning through top-down national curriculums tested through exam structures only. The timetable prioritises academic subjects and not practices which will benefit the overall well-being and health of our young generation.
attributes.additional_details:
We are living in a rapidly changing world of technology, yet the UK state school system still appears to be in the Victorian times. 
We need to prioritise 11-16 students to leave school not deficient in  essential skills required for life- a knowledge of the law, banking, money management and debt, health and diet, culinary skills, the environment, music, forging positive human relationships and public speaking skills has never been so paramount.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We understand you'd like the National Curriculum to change, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like to be included. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: 5 Year Ban and from National Parks and unlimited fine if you're caught littering
attributes.background:
If caught littering in a national park you should receive a 5 year ban.
You can reduce this sentence by performing community service cleaning a national park or choose it over a fine.
Trespass after offence should be added to criminal record, offender then needing to wear a tag to prevent trespass
attributes.additional_details: Litter is killing our wildlife, polluting our waters and damaging our ecosystems, in areas of outstanding beauty people are damaging them and it must be taken seriously, offenders don't deserve to get away with this and should be expelled from these areas if caught and forced to clean them, it's disgusting and these people should be forced to repair the damage that they have committed to the environment.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about banning someone from a national park or parks would be a matter for the relevant parks authority, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase fixed penalty fines for littering: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581996

attributes.action: SEND children to be able to access specialist provision and EHCPS to be abided.
attributes.background: There is a huge lack of specialist education provisions across the country. All children should be entitled to an appropriate education regardless of ability. Special needs and disabled children are being put into mainstream schools without their education plans being adhered to and failed.
attributes.additional_details:
There are thousands of disabled and extra needs children not being allocated a space within a specialist provision including our son. The correct supportive environment as a child reduces the cost later on to society as life skills and independency is taught alongside an individual curriculum.
Education plans which are incredibly difficult to achieve are not being adhered to even though they should be a legally binding contract. 
It is discrimination and failure by the Government.

attributes.action: Clarify laws regarding dog ownership, with particular focus on the needs of dogs
attributes.background: Having lived next door to neglected & abused dogs, heard the cries of despair from tethered dogs & puppies left in a shed in the snow, I want some action taken.Despite contacting various agencies, this neglect is not deemed illegal.This has to change. Domestic animals’ basic needs MUST be mandatory.
attributes.additional_details:
I want DEFRA’s Code of Practice for Welfare of Dogs to be put into law. As part of Section 9, Animal Welfare Act 2006, DEFRA clearly states the 5 basic needs of a dog. 
1. A suitable environment 
2. A suitable diet 
3. The need to be housed with or apart from other animals (including humans)
4. The need to be able to exhibit normal behaviour patterns
5. The need to be protected from pain, suffering, injury & disease. 
Sadly, as these are not “law” but recommendations, many dogs are suffering.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the welfare of dogs, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
The Animal Welfare Act already includes requirements for people who are responsible for an animal to meet its needs, including:

(a) its need for a suitable environment,
(b) its need for a suitable diet,
(c) its need to be able to exhibit normal behaviour patterns,
(d) any need it has to be housed with, or apart from, other animals, and
(e) its need to be protected from pain, suffering, injury and disease.

If there are additional requirements you want to be added to this, you could start a new petition explaining clearly what additions you would like.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Compulsory home checks and abusers database to protect animals: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330345

Introduce Dog Licensing and Registration: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563854

attributes.action: Ban the use of Per - and Polyfluoroalkyl Substances (PFAS) in UK food packaging.
attributes.background: There is strong evidence that Perfluoroalkyl and Polyfluoroalkyl Substances (PFAS) are found in UK food packaging. There are extensive studies that show these "forever chemicals" are an immanent threat to public health. They should be banned from manufacturing, like the global ban on the use of PFOA
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must commit to joining this phase-out of PFAS.
A growing body of science has found that there are potential adverse health impacts associated with PFAS exposure, including liver damage, thyroid disease, decreased fertility, high cholesterol, obesity, hormone suppression and cancer. 

Non-stick pans, furniture, cosmetics, household cleaners, clothing, and packaged food containers can all contain PFCs, many of which break down into PFOA in the environment or in the human body.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about PFAs, but we're not sure if you want the Government to ban their use in food packaging, or all manufacturing.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of  E-scooters and E-bikes for adults.

Scooters could be allowed on pavements where there is no danger to pedestrians.
attributes.additional_details:

attributes.action: Open pop-up vaccine clinics in closed/non-essential shops and restaurants.
attributes.background:
Help and encourage closed/non-essential shops and restaurants to offer their retail areas to the NHS - so that vaccine volunters can use the extra space to set up temporary, pop-up COVID-19 vaccine clinics. 

Lift any red tape preventing this, and provide incentives for companies that participate.
attributes.additional_details:
Two vaccines have been approved. Thousands of staff are waiting to deliver them. But much more space is needed to provide a socially distanced environment where vaccines can be administered and the 15 minute rest period can be taken.

Closed, non-essential shops and restaurants would be suited to this role. Companies would be eager to volunteer their retail areas, so vaccine rollout increases and shop closures end sooner. Large areas could be cleared and sanitised within a matter of hours.

rejection.details:
The Covid-19 vaccination programme, including the identification of sites suitable for delivery of the vaccine, is the responsibility of the NHS, not the Government or House of Commons.

The Government has already announced that vaccination centres are being set up to ensure vaccines are administered as quickly as possible. You can find out more here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/first-people-to-receive-oxford-universityastrazeneca-covid-19-vaccine-today-4-january-2021

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding to enable the NHS to increase the number of sites at which Covid-19 vaccinations are provided, although in practice the number of sites the NHS can operate will depend on the staff available to administer vaccinations.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory sustainability indicators on food and product packaging
attributes.background: Due to increased pressures regarding biodiversity decline and loss of natural habitats, the government should pass law that supermarkets and product manufacturers display how sustainable their products are on the packaging. This could be in the form of an additional traffic light style guide.
attributes.additional_details:
Unless we act fast and educate the general public in an accessible and digestible way, we're going to run out of time and see the collapse of the natural living world. Such a small change to how food and consumer products are presented could have a dramatic, positive impact to consumer behaviour. 

Not only would the additional indicators hugely benefit our environment, they'd be likely to have positive economic impacts due to local UK products being favourable over unsustainable import goods.
